title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson and Dayana Slade were charged in the September fatal shooting of Mike Jonas in Brockton.
Thompson, 35, faces first-degree murder charges, while Slade, 25, is charged with accessory after the fact.
Thompson was held without bail; Slade received a $250,000 cash bail following their arrests in Maine.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Red Sox attempted to trade for Los Angeles Angels shortstop Zach Neto this offseason.
Zach Neto has achieved consecutive 20-20 seasons and hit 49 homers in the last two years.
Instead, Boston acquired Caleb Durbin in a six-player trade, as a deal for Neto couldn't be reached.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, 72, sentenced to one day in prison for RMV bribery, putting unqualified drivers on roads.
Cardosa engaged in a bribery scheme with an RMV employee to pass 100-300 applicants from 2019 to 2021.
Prosecutors cited Cardosa's health issues for reduced sentence; he will serve six months home incarceration.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B have reportedly broken up after unfollowing each other on Instagram post-Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Stefon Diggs faces felony strangulation and misdemeanor assault charges, with an arraignment set for February 13, 2026.
Diggs and Cardi B welcomed a baby boy in November 2025, their first child together, amidst a high-profile relationship.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora expressed pride in Bad Bunny's all-Spanish Super Bowl LX halftime show performance.
Cora praised Bad Bunny for representing Puerto Rico and showcasing cultural elements on a global stage.
Bad Bunny faced criticism but NFL Commissioner Goodell supported his role as a unifying performer.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of redacted body cam footage from the Brown University shooting which killed two students.
Footage includes police coordination and response; police investigation into the incident is now closed, officials announced.
Shooter Claudio Manuel Neves Valente killed at Brown, then in Brookline, before dying by suicide in a New Hampshire storage unit.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Keion White, a 49ers player and former Patriots lineman, underwent surgery after being shot in the ankle.
The shooting occurred in San Francisco hours after the Super Bowl; no arrests have been made yet.
This marks the second 49ers player shooting in 18 months, following an incident with receiver Ricky Pearsall in 2024.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum has been assigned to practice with the Maine Celtics as he nears return from an Achilles injury.
Tatum has been participating in 5-on-5 scrimmages and is progressing ahead of schedule in his rehab.
Boston Celtics, second in the Eastern Conference, are cautious about Tatum's return, prioritizing his full recovery.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers were rescued near the summit of Camel’s Hump mountain in Duxbury, Vermont, amid life-threatening conditions.
The hikers faced sub-zero temperatures with wind chills near minus 20 degrees and deep snow, leading to hypothermia.
Emergency crews successfully guided them to safety, with one walker assisted and the other using a stretcher; both are recovering.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots aim to improve their offensive line after Seattle's defense overwhelmed them in Super Bowl LX.
New England plans to add new offensive weapons for QB Drake Maye, considering free agency or trades.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez is prioritized for a new contract after standout performances in postseason.
